column4: why does linux-686 depend on linux-image-2.6.10-5-686? just hasn't been updated, or is there a reason they're not using 2.6.11?
probably since 2.6.10-5 is considered more stable

yeah, I always had to find time to get around to compiling a new kernel, then recompiling when I found I was missing a feature =P I've compiled enough that it's no longer interesting, it's just a chore
I agree. Ubuntu actually makes one productive. :)
